is a small town in Snyder County,

. Latitude: 40.85 N, Longitude: 76.82 W. The town lies approximately 50 minutes north of Harrisburg, PA and 50 minutes south of Williamsport, PA. Located in the central part of the state, along the Susquehanna River, Shamokin Dam is approximately 157 miles (three hours drive) from Philadelphia, three hours from New York, four hours from Washington-Baltimore and four hours (212 miles) from Pittsburgh. State College, home of the Pennsylvania State University, is 1 hour 31 minutes drive along PA Rte 45.

value: Harrisburg International Airport is located about 63.5 miles and 1 hour and 15 minutes from Shamokin Dam. Harrisburg International is served by seven major airlines which provide nonstop daily service to 12* domestic and 1 international destination with one-stop service to cities around the world. Several major rental car companies have a presence at the airport complex. Parking for the physically disabled is in all three parking lots. Special handicap accessible busses are available 24 hours a day for those parking in the SmartPark, long-term lot. There are a total of nine elevators located in the parking garage and the terminal building, six escalators in the parking garage and terminal building, and moving sidewalks on the second floor of the parking garage. Restrooms throughout the terminal are handicap accessible. In addition, there are five private unisex companion-care restrooms in the terminal building. A TDD/TTY phone is available to contact hotel shuttle and off-site rental car providers in the baggage claim area of the terminal building. For more information on any of these services, contact Customer Information Desk at +1 (717) 948-5900 between 7AM and 11PM.
is located just outside State College, Pa. Served by United Airlines, Northwest, US AIR-express. There is car rental service on site. Secure parking is provided. +1 (814) 237-2011

lies just a few miles south of Shamokin Dam at 100 Airport Road, Selinsgrove, PA 17870, in Penn Township, Snyder County. Lat North 40° 50° 59" Lon West 76° 50° 59". It serves private and charter planes. The airport recently built a new terminal and the runway has been modified to provide express service to cities such as Harrisburg, Pittsburgh, and Philadelphia.

Located in Northeastern Pennsylvania, Wilkes-Barre - Scranton International Airport is located 80.17 miles (about two hours) northeast of Shamokin Dam and is served by many major airlines and all major rental car companies.

with access at the Sunbury Fabridam in the Adam T. Bower State Park.

value: on the Sunbury side of the river has a public boat launch and docks.

passes through Shamokin Dam.

Narrow and/or unpaved shoulders along most side streets make biking around town (off the highway) challenging. Route 11 from Shamokin Dam to Northumberland is lovely with a view of the river. There is, however, heavy truck traffic along this route.

Shamokin Dam is approximately 60 miles (45 minutes) north of Pennsylvania's capital city of Harrisburg. That city has a station on Amtrak's Keystone and Pennsylvanian train routes. Shamokin Dam is a 45 minute drive north on Rte 322 then Rtes 11&15.

Shamokin Dam is accessible from Interstate 80, which runs East-West north of the area. Pennsylvania routes 11&15 merge north of Harrisburg and serve as the main transportation artery for central Pennsylvania. Most of Shamokin Dam's shopping district lies along Rtes 11 and 15. South of Shamokin Dam, 11/15 South connects with Rte 322, Interstates 81, 83 and eventually, the Pennsylvania Turnpike (Harrisburg Area) west to Pittsburgh and east to Philadelphia.

One area challenge for drivers is that on Fridays and holiday weekends the traffic backs up and slows on Rte 11. Early morning travel can avoid the problem. Additionally, Rte 11 along the river towards Northumberland, is often closed when there is flooding. Those seeking to access Route 80 can use Route 15 to connect by traveling a few miles north of Lewisburg. This drive is a four lane highway with some red lights in the Lewisburg area.

value: The Adam T. Bower Memorial Dam
also called the Sunbury Fabridam or Fabri Dam.
This shallow body of water is created by the inflated Adam T. Bower Memorial Dam. It was named after Fort Augusta, a frontier outpost located in the vicinity of Sunbury during colonial times.

content=P.O.Box 276, Middleburg, PA 17842. The Snyder County Historical Society preserves the heritage and culture of Snyder County through research archives and educational events. Incorporated in 1898, the Society assists students and others who are interested in the area with historical research. Museum Hours: Sundays 1:30 - 5PM, May through September Free Admission Library Hours: Monday, Thursday-Friday 10AM - 3:30PM Sundays (May through September only) 1:30 - 5PM The library is closed holidays and during bad weather. Fees: Use is free for members, $2 for non-members. During January and February, the library is open by appointment only, and there is a service fee of $5 per hour.

content=Sunbury, PA. It offers a museum of historical and archaeological artifacts dealing with Fort Augusta, from the French and Indian War through the American Revolution, as well as items of significance to the history of Northumberland County. The museum is open March – December, Monday, Wednesday & Friday, 1 to 4PM Library hours are Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 1 to 4PM March through December, holidays excepted, from 1 to 4PM

Route 15 , Allenwood, PA. 17810. +1 570 538-1869 (800)REPTILAND. Reptiland is an AZA accredited zoo specializing in reptiles and amphibians. Since opening in 1964, Reptiland has provided the public a link to the less-loved members of the animal kingdom. School groups, families and individuals with an interest in natural history agree - Reptiland offers a perfect blend of environmental education and entertainment. 35 minutes from Shamokin Dam 25 miles north on Route 15.

Hours May through October – the museum complex (Visitor Center and historic buildings) are open Thursday through Saturday, 10AM to 5PM, Sunday, 1:00 to 5PM Last tour begins no later than 4PM November through April – the Visitor Center only is open Thursday through Saturday, 10AM to 5PM Group tours are offered Monday through Saturday 9AM to 5PM from April to November (weather permitting). Twenty minute drive from Shamokin Dam.

For additional exploration of heritage, culture, dining and shopping in the Central Susquehanna Valley, be sure to check out Lewisburg, PA and Sunbury, PA. Amish farms are nearby on Routes 11 & 15 Port Trevorton and along Route 45. Look for the hand made quilts blowing in the breeze along the highway. They frequently have raodside stands featuring farm products including fresh baked goods, eggs, and vegetables.

Sports fans will find Hershey Bears ice hockey in Hershey PA about 1 hour away. Red Barons baseball and Wilkes-Barre - Scranton Penguins hockey are all within a two hour drive. State College, home of Penn State University, is also about 45 minutes away and offers additional cultural, sports (Nittany Lions), and entertainment options. PSU's Bryce jordon Center offers many top name entertainment acts, as well as college sports. Longer distances will take you to the Atlantic coastline.
